Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Tening (debout à l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle a en charge sept de ses neveux. 

Elle est vendeuse de kola, d’oseille, de gombo et divers autres produits qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire de la sous région pour la revente dans sa localité. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de cinq ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner dans ces divers produits kola, oseille pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’accroître son  troupeau en parti et de mettre sa famille dans des conditions meilleures.
texts.en:
The Wakilaré de Coumbanbouré group ( which means perseverance in Fula) was created on the 11th July 2008 at the inauguration of the banc villageois (village bank).It is made up of 14 women who all live in the same village and are very determined in their lucrative activitis.They  all have small businesses.

Madame Tening  (standing on the far right) is the leader of the group. She is 45. She is married with one child, she also takes care of seven of her nephews.

She sells kola, sorrel, gumbo and various other products that she buys at the regional weekly market for resale in her village. She has been in this business for over five years.   

Her new loan will enable her to stock up on various products such as kola, sorrel for resale.

The profits from this activity will help to enlarge her flock and offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to stock up on various pruducts such as kola and sorrel for resale.

loans.name: Pilar Juanita

texts.es: Pilar es una mujer de 48 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su negocio. su historia empezó cuando sus padres empezaron a trabajar en el negocio de alquiler de sillas en la playa. cuando ella era pequeña se dedicaba a la venta de colas en la playa desde ese entonces creció en este ambiente y decidió alquilar silla, su trabajo lo hace con los hijos todos los días, no tiene dificultades, está casada, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es incrementar más en su negocio y tener su propio local donde guarda su propia herramienta de trabajo. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar sillas y toldos.
texts.en:
Pilar is a 48-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her business over the next few years.

Pilar's business story began when her parents began to work renting chairs on the beach. When she was young she used to sell soft drinks on the beach. Since then the environment has grown considerably she began to also rent out chairs. She performs her job alongside with her children every day. She has no considerable difficulties and is married with one daughter. Her dream is to grow her business more and have her own place where she can store her work tools. She is requesting the loans to purchase chairs and awnings.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and awnings

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Ms. Merry is 30 years old, married, living at Lumban, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with two siblings of school age.

Ms. Merry is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She borrowed money for educational financial assistance. Therefore, Ms. Merry hope to improve her living conditions with the use of the profits from her existing business.

loans.use: to pay for  education on her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Sok Rorn

texts.en: Sok Rorn, 49, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rice and employed in garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory as well. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. In order to improve her agricultural business, Sok Rorn is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cattle to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to purchase timbers to cover her house’s wall and help her children get bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use in her farming work

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Through the years, it has come to Lydia's realization that she can not bank on only teacher remuneration to bring a desired value to her life and that of her 3 kids.
It was after lots of stock taking that she decided she had to open up an auxiliary source of income.
3 years ago is when 32 year old Lydia ventured into a liquor store business in Bushenyi.
In many respects, this business has financially empowered her and enabled her open up new horizons as regards the provision of better welfare to her family.
Lydia also ekes out more income from Farming.
She says she will use her loan money to purchase better liquor making drums and high grade manure to improve the fertility of her farm and  her crop yields.

loans.use: to improve the fertility of her farm and her crop yields.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 52, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a retired teacher. Three of her children are employed; two are mechanics and another one is employed in a private company. They earn approximately USD 15 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Chenda is requesting for a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money in her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim wants a loan to complete his commercial house. He is a charcoal and shoe seller in Masindi, Uganda. He is age 40 and charged with a responsibility of taking care of his ten children and wife. Customers not paying on time is his major challenge. He desires to educate his children, build a permanent home and buy a car.

loans.use: to complete his commercial house

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel, 30 years and with no Kids yet, is a general merchandise retail business enterprenuer based in Ibanda.
5 years approximately is the time, he has been involved in this business and he says despite the inevitable challenges he has encountered, he has not been unnerved much.
Its for that reason that his optimism about the future success of his business remains sky high.
At his shop, he sells goods such as sugar, salt, maize flour, rice, beans, etc
Abel too ekes out more income from motorcycle transportation.
He plans on using his loan to purchase more bags of sugar, salt, maize flour, rice,cooking oil, etc to resell

loans.use: to purchase more bags of sugar, salt, maize flour, rice,cooking oil, etc to resell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer and the business is doing great.Michael was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, to buy farm inputs and prepare his land for the next season of planting. 
 
He hopes to grow his business and become famous farmer who practices mixed farming in large scale.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare his land  for next season of planting

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Germqaine est une jeune commercante agee de 25 ans, celibataire et mere d'un enfant qui va deja a l'ecole. elle fait son commerce depuis 4 ans et diversifier ses produits.

loans.use: renforcer son fond de roulement

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que a pesar de las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, ha tenido la fortaleza para poder salir adelante y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Diana es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, a quien su padre abandonó desde hace un tiempo sin contribuir económicamente para su sostenimiento. Es por esto que Diana decidió montar su propio negocio el cual le permitiera estar al cuidado de su hijo y a la atención del negocio en el mismo tiempo. Así fue como montó su restaurante en el cual ofrece gran variedad de productos y el cual ha tenido muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Diana busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, pues actualmente tiene más pedidos por parte de los clientes de los que está en la capacidad de atender. 
Diana espera que de esta manera pueda aumentar las ventas atendiendo los pedidos de clientes que antes no podía atender. Además, Diana espera que su negocio siga saliendo adelante y sueña con que su restaurante crezca y le permita generar más empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who, in spite of the adversities that have been presented to her in life, has had the fortitude to be able to advance and generate the necessary income to sustain her household. Diana is a single mother and the head of a family with a four-year-old son, whose father abandoned him some time ago without contributing to his financial support. It is for this reason that Diana decided to set up her own business, which would permit her to take care of her son and tend to the business at the same time. So it was that she set up her restaurant, in which she offers a great variety of products and which has had a very good reception on the part of her customers, thanks to the good quality of her products. Diana is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals, since now she has more orders from her customers than she has the capacity to fill.

Diana hopes that in this way she can increase her sales, by filling the orders of customers who in the past she was unable to serve. Furthermore, Diana hopes that her business will continue to advance and dreams that her restaurant will grow and permit her to generate more jobs for the people most in need.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food in her restaurant, since now she has more orders from her customers than she is able to fill

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: With the launch of her contemporary art gallery, Jessica, a practicing freelance lawyer, was able to see her lifelong dream come true. Jessica has always had a passion for all types of art and has worked very hard to put herself in a position to transform this passion into a sustainable life. Located in an artsy district of New York City, her gallery is very diverse. It offers original pieces in paintings, drawings, limited edition photographs, and mixed media. The gallery is also very diverse in the services that it offers. Not only can customer’s purchase art in the store and on arttogift.com, but she also offers art rental and art consultations for inexperienced buyers looking to learn. Working two full time jobs though has proven to be strenuous. Jessica would like this loan to help her attend more art fairs to further promote her gallery. She would like to continue the growth of her business and one day get to a point where it is a sustainable source of revenue and she can narrow her focus to only operating the gallery.

loans.use: to attend art fairs and publicize her gallery

loans.name: Lucho

texts.es:
Lucho de 36 años, convive con Olivia, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Yavirironi, distrito de Río Negro Satipo. Lucho es un hombre constante. Trabaja la tierra produciendo café, cacao, maíz y plátanos. La agricultura es lo que le gusta realizar. A los 17 años ya laboraba apoyando a sus padres. Ahora que ya tiene una esposa e hijos, realiza esta misma actividad pero con más ahínco, porque los gastos son mayores.
Cuenta con 1 parcela solo de plantaciones de café. Al año cosecha de 200 a 300 kilos, pero este año cree que aumentará su producción. Las ventas son buenas, pero  Lucho quisiera producir más.
“Cada kilo de café lo vendo a 7 soles, el cacao está a 4 soles por kilo, pero el año pasado estaba a 6 soles, dice, confiado en que este año sus resultados sean mejores.
Uno de sus planes es adquirir otra parcela para sembrar más plantas. Así le brindará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso agradece su ayuda anticipadamente. Menciona que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. “Inkani” es el nombre de su reciente banco comunal, se muestra emocionado de trabajar con personas cuyos intereses son similares. Con el dinero podrá pagar al personal que contratará para la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucho, 36, lives with Olivia with whom he has two children who are 6 and 2 years old.  They all live together in their own house in the indigenous community of Yavirironi, Río Negro Satipo District.  Lucho is a steady man.  He works the land producing coffee, cocoa beans, corn and bananas.  Farming is what he likes to do.  At the age of 17 he worked helping out his family.  Now that he has a wife and children he still does the same kind of work but with more dedication because expenses are greater.

He has a parcel of land planted just with coffee.  He harvests from 200 to 300 kilograms per year but he thinks that this year production will increase.  Sales are good but Lucho would like to produce more.  “I sell each kilo of coffee for 7 soles and the cocoa beans are at four soles per kilo but last year it went up to 6,” he states confident that this year his results will be better.  One of his plans is to acquire another parcel to plant more so that he can provide better quality of life for his family. 

This would be his first loan with MFP so he’s thanking you in advance for your support.  He mentions that he will make his monthly payments punctually.  This recent communal bank is called “Inkani” and he’s excited about working with people with similar interests. With the money he will be able pay the staff he will hire to clear the fields and provide crop maintenance.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, father of 1, is a  retail businessman plying his trade in Bushenyi. 
He has been bearing a hand in this trade for close to 2 years.
This is quite a short time but he is upbeat about his future prospects.
At his shop, he sells general merchandise retail stock such as maize flour, soft drinks, rice, beans, peas, soap, sugar, etc
He says he will bank on this kiva loan to purchase more maize flour, soft drinks, bread, rice, beans, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, soft drinks, bread, rice, beans, etc to resell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Ms. Arlyn, age 27, is a businesswoman. She is married and resides in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with three siblings of school age.

Ms. Arlyn is a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and borrowed money from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional business capital. 

Therefore, Ms. Arlyn will improve her living conditions with the profits.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for the business .

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba  prepares a local dish called Banku which she serves with fried fish and sauce.  She also extracts palm kernel oil to sell at Eguago, near Elmina.  She has been in this business for some time now.   

Aba is married to a farmer and they have 3 children.  She uses her income to support her husband feed and clothe their children.  She will use her loan to purchase more maize and fresh fish and also palm kernel.  They will be used for the preparation of food and the extraction of oil to sell.  Aba will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: buy maize, fish and palm kernel

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a businessman.  He does maize and banana farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for  8 years and has employed 4 people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Issac has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy maize seeds and fertilizer .

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. He has toilet rooms that he rents to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person.   Since he joined Faulu Kenya, John has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to build more toilets.

loans.use: build more rental toilets

loans.name: Libia Mercedes

texts.es: Libia es una mujer de 23 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó cuando trabaja en el almacén y decidió comprar un catalogo y uniforme a vender, su trabajo lo hace con su hermana de 9 AM hasta la 5 PM, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un local propio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para la comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, sabanas etc.
texts.en: Libia is a 23 year-old woman and she has many aspirations for the coming years to prosper in her sales. Her story starts when she was working in a store and decided to buy a catalog and a uniform for selling. She does her work with her sister, from 9AM until 5PM. If she has any difficulties, it is crime. She is not married. She doesn’t have children. Her most important dream is to have her own store. She wants the loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, and sheets

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: Ricardina de 33 años convive con oscar de 32 años con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en el centro poblado de Omaya del distrito de Pichari. Ricardina es una mujer de mucho talento para con los trabajos en la agricultura, ella cultiva cacao en su parcela que esta ubicado en el centro poblado de Omaya desde los 19 años de edad juntamente con su querido esposo. Ellos trabajan de lunes a viernes de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, mientras que los sábados se dedican a otro negocio. En su parcela agrícola, tiene cultivos de cacao, café que son productos que en estos últimos años está teniendo una buena acogida en los mercados nacionales e internacionales es por esta razón que Ricardina, continua incrementando sus cultivos de cacao con la finalidad de lograr una mayor producción para luego obtener un ingreso económico con el que pueda solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Ricardina está feliz y contento con la actividad que realiza, por que hasta ahora todo le va muy bien gracias a ese esfuerzo que ella pone en su trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente  el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Ricardina, 33, lives with Oscar, 32, with whom she has three children.  They live in the small town of Omaya in the district of Pichari.

Ricardina is a woman with a lot of talent for agricultural work.  She has grown cacao on her plot of land in the small town of Omaya along with her beloved husband since she was 19 years old.  They work Monday through Friday from 7:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, while Saturday they work selling clothing in the market of their town.

On her plot of farmland she has cacao plants, which are very well-received products in the national and international markets these last few years.  This is why Ricardina continues increasing her cacao plants, with the goal of getting a larger crop to later have an income with which she can pay the family expenses.

Ricardina is happy and contented with the job she does because up to now everything has gone very well for her thanks to this effort she puts into her work.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she promises to make her payments punctually.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Atilio, de 32 años; padre de 02 hermosos hijos Yulisa de 11 años y Jerónimo de 01 año y  esposo de Agustina de 29 años; juntos  residen en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Desde muy temprano Atilio, se dirige a su campo de cultivo para  ver el crecimiento y avance de sus plantones de cacao que con mucho esmero logró obtener; esta actividad empezó a realizar durante 12 años y comenta que no lo ha logrado tan fácil  ya que tuvo que pasar por muchas cosas para lograr obtener lo que ahora tiene. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a las cosechas que obtiene puede solventar los gastos de su familia; para él su trabajo le es difícil en las temporadas de lluvia porque es donde no puede ver el avance ni mucho menos realizar el desmonte que aquejan su producción. Con el tiempo quiere obtener grandes producciones, cultivando mas plantas de cacao para que de esa manera llegue tener una buena economía y velar por su familia.  Pero por el momento su mayor prioridad es mantener sanos a sus siembras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan ya que de esa manera logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago y quedar mal con sus compañeros de su banco comunal. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles podrá comprar funguicidas naturales para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Atilio, 32, is the father of two beautiful children: Yulisa, 11, and Jerónimo, 1, and husband of Agustina, 29. They live together in their own house where happiness reigns. 

Atilio heads out to his fields very early to check on his cocoa bean plants’ growth and development which he attains with much dedication. He started this activity 12 years ago and comments that it’s not been easy because he had to go through a lot to obtain what he now has. What he likes best about his work is that thanks to the harvests he obtains he’s able to cover his family’s expenses. 

However, it is difficult during the rainy season because he can’t see the advance or even worse is unable to clear out the weeds that invade his plants. In time he wants to obtain great harvests cultivating more cocoa bean plants so that he can obtain a better economy and watch over his family. But for now, his greatest priority is to keep his crops healthy.
 
This will be loan #1 with MFP. He feels happy for the support he’s being given because he will be able to reach his objectives. He also commits to being very punctual with his installment payments and not disappoint his fellow communal bank members. He will use the 1500 new soles to buy natural fungicides for crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fungicide.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Florentina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesana en cartapacios, venta de choclos, venta de verduras, costura de bermudas y chamarras, macramé de mantas, costura de mandiles.

La señora Florentina, indica que forma parte de la asociación por primera vez. Ya que ella cuenta con un negocio de trenzado de mantas la que quiere aumentar su mercadería.

El crédito de este ciclo es para aumentar su capital (compra de hilos y tela) que adquirirá de las ferias paceñas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

En la foto se encuentra una acompañante, ella es la hermana de la señora Martha que se encuentr de chompa celeste a rayas
texts.en:
The communal bank "FLOR DE PAPA" is beginning is first cycle in the Pro Mujer program, run by the Panamerican Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and is led by a board of directors chaired by Mrs. Florentina.  The members are involved in different businesses which include:  handcrafted satchels, sale of corn, sale of vegetables, sewing and macramé.

Florentina has joined the association for the first time and says she has a blanket weaving business and wants to increase her merchandise.

This loan is to increase work capital by buying thread and yarn at the trade fairs so she can produce goods to fill orders.  The work allows her to support her family.  She is married and has a son.

Shown in a blue striped sweater is a sister of one of the members (Martha).

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old. He is from Nyahururu and is married to Lucy. They have two children who are in school.

Daniel is a farmer and has been in this business for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

He hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal La Fe está conformado por 10 emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante, todo los emprendedores se brindan ideas para mejorar en sus negocios. Este grupo de emprendedores son de la misma localidad y se unieron para emprender juntos cambios en sus negocios y brindarles a sus clientes variedad de productos y un buen servicio. Telma Del Socorro es una emprendedora parte de este grupo su actividad económica a la que se dedica al destace de cerdos en cual ya tiene varios años de experiencia  ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que le compran su productos, el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar más cerdos y abastecerse.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Fe is made up of 10 entrepreneurs who joined together to progress. All the entrepreneurs offer ideas to improve their businesses. The entrepreneurs in the group are from the same town and they got together to launch joint changes in their businesses and to offer good service and a variety of products to their customers. 

Telma Del Socorro is an entrepreneur in the group and she makes a living by butchering pigs. She already has several years of experience and has both regular and occasional customers who buy her products. The loan she is requesting is to buy more pigs and stock up.

loans.use: to buy pigs and stock up

loans.name: Chirongo

texts.en: Chirongo is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges, tomatoes, mangoes, tomatoes, maize, beans etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located along a busy shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of vegetables and fruits. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. His business goal and dream is to own a big farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of  vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Duo San Raymundo Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN RAYMUNDO
Este dúo está formado por Miriam Leonor, de 29 años de edad, ella es soltera, y es dueña de una pequeña tienda ubicada en la entrada de San Raymundo, desde hace año y medio y nos cuenta que desde hace varios meses  ha estado pensado en adquirir un crédito pero que las circunstancias no se lo han permitido ahora quiere que Fape Y KIVA pueda apoyarla ya que su tienda necesita de algunos productos comestibles de consumo diario que aun no tiene en su tienda por falta de dinero, también esta doña Lorena, de 26 años de edad tiene 3 hijos,Y ella esta solicitando este credito para compra de mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
San Raymundo Duo

This duo includes Miriam Leonor, 29 years old. She is single and has been the owner of a small store located at the entrance of San Raymundo for a year and a half. She tells us that for a few months now she has been thinking about getting a loan, but that circumstances haven't permitted her.  

Now she wants FAPE and Kiva to be able to help her now that her store needs some food products for daily consumption that she still doesn't have in her store due to lack of money. 

Lorena, 26 years old, is also part of the duo. She has 3 children, and is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy food products for daily consumption

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 33-year old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a driving school which he started six years ago. His starting capital was 500,000 shillings but now it's worth shillings. Although he has progressed in his business, Abel faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. His dream is educating his children and expanding his business into new markets. He needs this loan to pay for the license to operate for his driving school.

loans.use: to pay for the license to operate his driving school.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joy wants a loan to buy maize, beans, posho (maize flour or a porridge made from it), tomatoes, cattle, goats, and pigs for sale. Aged 38 years, she lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

The responsibility of taking care of her four children rests on her. Her dream is to educate them to university level.

Joy started by farming, sold her cassava, and started market vending. Her desire is to educate her children and move her business to permanent premises.

loans.use: buy maize, beans, posho, tomatoes, cattle, goats, and pigs for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama cooks banku (a dish made from corn dough) for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Amoanda near Cape Coast.  She is married to a farmer and has 3 children.  Ama has been into this business for 3 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in the gerneral upkeep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she will use to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she will use to prepare her banku for sale

loans.name: Cesar  Guadalupe

texts.es: El joven  Cesar es una persona que le gusta vivir cómodamente   por  lo cual  se  esfuerza  día  con día,el se preocupa  por  acondicionar  su  vivienda es  por  ello  que  se  acerco a la  institución porque requiere  pintar las paredes del exterior de su casa ,ve  en el crédito la posibilidad de que  su  vivienda tenga  una  mejor   imagen es por  ello que agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Cesar is a person who likes to live comfortably so he strives daily to fix up his house.  This is why he called on the institution because he wants to paint his house so that it will have a better appearance.  He is grateful for the support provided by the institution for his project.

loans.use: Pintar  paredes del exterior de su casa.

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Unisa. He is married and has 2 children ages 12 and 3 years. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him and assist him in the shop. In 1997, Unisa established his provisions, soap, and cigarette business. He began his business just  to enable him abandon a shepherd job as he was previously a cattle rarer in a bush. 

This business is the only source of livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Unisa has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy bond street cigarettes, mayonnaise, sardines, peak milk, and soap.

Unisa hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately  400,000 SLL. In the future, Unisa plans to own a house, to establish a larger business, and to travel to the holy land of Mecca. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions, soap, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Abu. He is married and his spouse is purely a housewife. They have 3 children ages 10, 7 years and 2 months.Two of their children go to school. Abu has one additional dependent who lives with him to assist in his business.

In 2001, Abu established his business selling A4 papers, ledger books, paper files, plastic files, markers, flip charts, chalk, staple machines, and paper punches.  Working 7 days week and 9 hours a day, he earns about 2,330,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Abu would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Abu requires a loan in order to purchase the following items:  A4 papers - 20 cartons @ 87,000 SLL; chalk - 6 cartons @ 160,000 SLL; staple machine - 4 cartons @ 150,000 SLL; and markers - 50 dozens @ 14,000 SLL.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to educate his children to university level, build a house, and expand his business in different areas.  He feels good about taking the loan because all business people need loans and this loan will help him to improve the business.

Abu's major problem is frequent increase in rent. Competition is high but he is different from competitors because he does photocoping, laminating, and binding of documents. He serves 50 customers per day.  His business is popular because of the photocoping and the items he sells are in use by a majority of people. Abu is assisted by family members. His suppliers are located in Freetown. He transports his supplies by public vehicle and travels twice in a month to get his goods. He puts back his profit into the business, he plans to expand the business, which can be achieved by proper use of capital and profit. He is a hardworking and trustworthy businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy A4 papers - 20 cartons @ Le87,000, chalk - 6 cartons @ Le160,000, staple machine - 4 cartons @ Le150,000 and markers - 50 dozens @ Le14,000.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She owns a retail shop, which has been in operation for the last two years.  Naomi started the business because there are no shops around the area she lives in.

She learned about Milango from her friend and joined in order to gain access to credit.  She has repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.  Naomi is now applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to add stock to her retail business. 

Her business faces challenges including the high cost of products and fees paid to various government entities.  Despite these challenges, Naomi looks forward to establishing additional centers in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop.

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is 32 years old and married with 2 children.  He does carpentry to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 16 years and has employed 3 people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joanes has been able to improve his living standards and he hopes to expand his business in the future. 

Joanes has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to make cupboards for sale.

loans.use: buy timber to make cupboards

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 45 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells bananas to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 7 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income, she does maize farming. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Veronica has been able to educate her children and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Armando is 50 years of age, married and has six grown up children. He plans to improve his family's living conditions and give his family a better life. With his wife, they help each other in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high production. They have been farmers for almost 28 years and they usually earn profits of P25,000 in every harvest season. Armando utilizes his income for his family's food, clothing and allowances for his youngest child. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Armando planned to expand his rice plantation to increase his yields but due to inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan of P45,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost in planting rice. He believes that the loan will help his family improve their rice farming business and he is hoping that they will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost in planting rice.

loans.name: Butunduzi Fal Instructors Group

texts.en:
Joy is a 36-year-old woman.  She lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her children and her desire is to educate them through higher institutions of learning.  She is a farmer with eight years of experience.  Her business remains feasible although she faces the challenge of limited capital.

She is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other in order to access a loan.  Joy intends to use this loan to buy agricultural inputs for the next season.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for next season

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly wants a loan to complete the construction of her commercial building.  She lives in Masindi, Uganda and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children.  She is a teacher by profession and, with the money she has saved from her salary, she has been able to start building a commercial building.  Her dream is to educate her children and to own a housing estate.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her commercial building.

loans.name: Untie  Christina

texts.en: Untie Christina cooks yams to sell. She serves them with vegetable sauce at Jukwa near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security officer.  Christina has been into this business for 8 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their children.  She will use her loan to purchase large quantities of yams, fish and vegetables which she will use to prepare her cooked yams. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked yams.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of yams, fish and vegetables which she will use to prepare her cooked yams for sale.

loans.name: Tannia Jacinta

texts.es: Tannia de 30 años vive (libertad ecuador)  el negocio que ella desempeña es familiar. Con mucho esfuerzo ella realiza su trabajo sola, limpiando y arregalando la paja para la venta de de sonbreros. Su trabajo no tiene horario ya que se queda hasta tarde. Lo que le impide trabajar bien es la lluvia . a futuro ella desea tener su casa propia. Con el préstamo desea comprar(paja toquilla) para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tannia is 30, and lives in Libertad, Ecuador. The business she carries on is a family business. She does her work alone and with a great deal of effort, cleaning and organizing straw for to make into hats.  She has no fixed hours for her work, as she stays working until late in the day. What can prevent her from working well is the rain. 

In the future she wishes to have her own house. She will use the loan to buy toquilla straw, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy toquilla straw.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 29 años, hace 4 años se casó con Lourdes con quien tiene 2 hijos. Él y toda su unida familia viven en una casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Yanama, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Percy es un hombre enérgico. Con la jovialidad que lo caracteriza se esfuerza mucho para trabajar la tierra. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica. Siembra arvejas, papas y flores de gladiolo. Percy es inteligente, sabe que es lo que le conviene, por eso, cuando los precios son favorables tanto en la ciudad de Lima como en Tarma, viaja para ambos destinos a ofrecer su producción.  “En julio llevo toda mi producción al mercado mayorista de Lima, ahí los precios son buenos”, cuenta. 
Por otra parte, posee animales: 2 toros, con los cuales ara tierras propias y ajenas, así obtiene 80 soles diarios. Además tiene ovejas, las que cría y vende, ganando dinero extra por su carne, pellejo, menudencias y patas. Así equilibra sus ingresos en distintas temporadas del año. Su meta es adquirir más terrenos y un toro más, para ello seguirá ahorrando y trabajando duro. Éste sería su crédito número 6 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Manantiales de Yanama”, donde se siente cómodo por trabajar con personas solidarias y de metas en común. Percy de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arvejas, lo restante será para comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
Percy is 29 years old, and for the last four years he has been married to Lourdes, with whom he has two children.  He and his whole family live in their own house, located in the village of Yanama, in the district of Palca-Tarma.  

Percy is an energetic man.  With the joviality that characterizes him, he puts great effort into working his land.  Farming is his principal money-earning activity. He grows peas, potatoes and gladioli flowers.  Percy is intelligent, and knows what he needs to do.  For this reason, when prices are as good in the city of Lima as in Tarma, he travels to both destinations to sell his products, travelling towards Lima.  "In July, I will take all my production to the wholesale market in Lima, where the prices are good", he notes.\

On the other hand, he also has animals: two bulls, with which he plows his own land as well as that belonging to others.  Doing this, he earns 80 soles a day.  He also has sheep, which he raises and sells, earning extra money for their meat, pelts, giblets and feet.  In this way he is able to balance out his income across the different seasons of the year.

His goal is to acquire more land and another bull, which is why he continues to save and to work hard.  This will be the sixth loan that he will receive from MFP, which is why he agrees to be punctual with his monthly repayments.  He is hoping for the support of all of you to continue with his objectives.  

He belongs to the “Los Manantiales de Yanama” ["The Springs of Yanama"] communal bank, where he feels comfortable working with supportive people who have goals in common.

On obtaining your support, Percy will invest the requested money in purchasing two bags of pea seeds.  The remainder will be used to purchase bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds and bags of manure.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 23 años, vive en compañía de sus padres: Adán y Armanda. Tiene un hermano menor de 13 años a quien educa con el ejemplo. Juntos viven en una casa de propiedad de la familia, ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo – Tarma. José es un buen hijo. Vio que sus padres se cansaban mucho en el trabajo del campo, y por eso decidió ayudarlos. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la agricultura y administra muy bien las ventas de sus productos. “Mis padres están mejor cuando yo me hago cargo de la chacra (terrenos de cultivos)”. Es por eso que emprendió sus sembríos de espinaca, alverja y flor de gladiolo, en terrenos propios y arrendados. Ya que necesita aprovechar las diferentes temporadas agrícolas.
José viaja con constancia hacia la ciudad de Lima, llevando sus productos y vendiéndolos al por mayor en el mercado de su ciudad. Sus padres solo se dedicaban a la producción, pero él los animó a salir de Tarma para buscar mejores ingresos; y les va muy bien.
Este joven enérgico, trabaja en lo que se le presente. “Hago de todo, a veces trabajo como peón en la chacra o en construcción”, dice sonriente. Con esa voluntad quiere adquirir un terreno propio para independizarse. Éste sería su crédito número 3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, dice sentirse a gusto con personas emprendedoras como él. Con el dinero podrá compra las semillas necesarias de espinacas que sembrará en este mes. Lo sobrante lo destinará en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos.
texts.en:
José, 23, lives with his parents, Adán and Armanda.  He has a 13 year old brother who he educates through his example.  They live together in a house belonging to the family located in Palcamaya-Tarma.  

José is a good son.   He saw how tired his parents became working in the fields so he decided to help them.  He’s been farming for three years and handles the sale of his products very well.  “My parents are better when I take charge of the “chacra” (farmland).”  This is why he started planting spinach, peas and gladioli on his own and on leased land because he needs to take advantage of the various farming seasons.

José travels constantly to the city of Lima taking his products and selling them at the wholesale market.  His parents used to just farm but he encouraged them to go beyond Tarma to seek better income and they are doing very well.

This energetic young man works at whatever comes up.  “I do a bit of everything; sometimes I work as a day laborer in the fields or in construction,” he says smiling.  With that willingness he wants to buy a piece of land of his own in order to become independent.

This would be loan #3 he gets from MFP so he takes on the responsibility of being punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” (Patron Saint Christopher) communal bank and he says that he feels comfortable with enterprising people like him.

With the money he will be able to buy the necessary spinach seeds he’ll plant this month.  Any remainder will be used to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: to buy spinach seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single & considered as third sex. 

Meriam is making and peddling home-made "siopao" (steamed buns) and boiled quail eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks of quail eggs & ingredients for making snacks.

Meriam has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of quail eggs & ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia is 59 years old, married, and has four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Eufronia runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. Eufronia has been running the rice retail business for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Eufronia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est mis en place depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de neuf femmes issues du même village. L'activité dominante est le petit commerce.



La responsable Kiné est âgée de 42 ans,elle est mariée mère de trois enfants et a en charge son petit fils; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite avec un châle bleu-blanc autour des épaules.

Elle achéte les légumes ( choux,aubergines, carottes,navets....) et les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier et agrandir ses activités afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus sur les légumes et moutons.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille sur le plan scolaire et sanitaire et souhaite développer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was established on December 30, 2009. It comprises nine women from the same village. The dominant work is small-scale commerce. 

Kiné is the group's official and is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also has a grandson to support. Her small business involves vegetables and concurrently the raising of sheep. She has good experience in these sectors. In the photo, she is seated at the right and wearing a blue-white shawl around her shoulders. 

Kiné purchases vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, carrots, turnips…) and sheep from the weekly markets and then sells them in her village. 

Her loan will serve to diversify and expand her businesses in order to make a lot of income from the vegetables and sheep. 

She helps out her husband with the family expenses with regard to schooling and health care. And she wishes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sop Mame Diarra est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est constitué de dix femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Faty est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants; 
elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes,de transformation artisanale d'huile d'arachide et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite avec un châle noir autour des épaules et tient un livret.

Elle achéte l'arachide, les légumes ( choux,aubergines, carottes,navets....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à diversifier et agrandir ses activités afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The "sop Mame Diarra" group was formed on 30th December 2009. In it are ten women who live in the same village. Their main business is local retailing and animal rearing. The leader Faty is 48 years old, she is married and the mother of four children. She has a small business selling vegetables, processing peanut oil, and she also rears some sheep as well. She has good experience in these areas. 
In the photo she is sitting on the right with a black shawl over her shoulders, holding a book.
She buys peanuts and vegetables (cabbage, aubergine, carrots, turnips....) at the weekly markets in order to sell in her village. The loan will allow her to diversify and grow her businesses in order to make substantial profits. She helps her husband cover the family's living expenses, and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes destinés à la vente

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Awa est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée mère de deux enfants, elle a en charge son petit fils; 
elle mène une activité de transformation d'huile d'arachide et un petit commerce de légumes, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite habillée en tissu teinté marron-blanc et couverte d'une écharpe rose autour des épaules.

Elle fait la transformation d'huile d'arachide après chaque récolte, achéte les légumes ( carottes, navets, aubergines....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend le tout dans son village. 


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter plus de légumes de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus; mais aussi agrandir ses activités.


Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou community group was formed on 30th December 2009, it is made up of eleven women who live in the same village.Their main businesses are local retailing and animal rearing.
Group leader Awa is 50 years old, a married mother of two children, she also has her grandson in the household. She has a business processing peanut oil and does some local vegetable trading - she has good experience in both these areas.
In the photo she is seated on the right dressed in brown and white cloth, with a pink scarf round her shoulders.
She processes peanut oil after every harvest, and buys vegetables (carrots, turnips, aubergines....) in the weekly markets - all for resale in her village. With her loan, she intends to buy more vegetables of good quality to meet her customers' needs, and to generate substantial income, while also growing her business. She assists with the family's living expenses and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: to process peanut oil and to sell vegetables.

loans.name: Boolo  Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Boolo Dolé est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2009, il est constitué de huit femmes qui habitent le même village. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

La responsable Maguette est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants; 
elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes,et fait parallèlement de l'élevage de moutons, elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est assise à droite habillée en khartoum bleu-rose avec un châle noir autour des épaules.

Elle achéte les légumes ( carottes, navets, aubergines....) dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre dans son village. 


Son prêt lui servira à acheter plus de légumes de bonne qualité pour satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses de la famille et souhaite augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Boolo Dolé community group was formed on 30th December 2009, comprising eight women who live in the same village. Their main activities are local retailing and animal rearing. Group leader Maguette is 45 years old, she is a married mother with four children. She runs a small business selling vegetables, and at the same time rears sheep - she has good experience in both areas.
In the photo she is seated on the right in a blue-pink outfit with a black shawl over her shoulders.
She buys vegetables (carrots, turnips, aubergines....) in the weekly markets to resell in her village. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables of good quality to meet her customers' needs, and to generate substantial income. She helps her husband with the family's expenses and would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes destinés à la vente.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 44 years old and married. He supports a family of 14 people and is blessed with seven children between the ages of 25 and 8 years  respectively. He has been in the business for four years and generates a monthly income of KES 42,000. Martin will be using the loan to increase stock in his kiosk. His anticipated profits will be used to pay for school fees for his children. This is his fourth loan with Kadet ltd after successfully repaying the previous ones. His hopes and dreams are to expand his shop into an wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for his shop.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 57, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over seven years; they have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. In addition, she sells sweet cakes to generate extra income to support the family. 

She earns approximately USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a mirror shop and earn about USD 6 per day. Due to difficulties in the family’s transportation, Mom is requesting for a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved from her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sobe 1 Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité sobé 1 a été créé le 31/12/2009,il est composé de 17 membres issus du meme village.
Madame coumba qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras,est la  responsable du groupe.Elle est âgée de 55 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 06 enfants et en charge aussi un autre enfant.

Son activité est la vente de marchandise comme les habits et chaussures et elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt  permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille en s'impliquant dans les frais pour la nourriture,les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
Community group sobé 1 was formed on 31st December 2009. In the group are 17 members, all from the same village. Coumba, who is on the far right in the photo, with her hand raised, is the group leader. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 6 children - with another child also in the household. Her business is selling merchandise like outfits and shoes, and she has been doing this for several years.
Her loan will allow her to buy sufficient stock to meet the demand. Her goal is to help cover the family's daily living costs by assisting with the costs of food and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman. She has seven children. Luvuno operates a charcoal-selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the general public. Luvuno's other source of income includes income from the children. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be high transport charges, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Luvuno will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Luvuno aspires to expand the business in the future. She joined Yehu to access cheap funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gbessay

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Gbessay. She is married and has six children aged 23, 17, 13, 12, 5 and 3 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2002, Gbessay established her raw fish business. She began her business just to develop herself and provide a livelihood for her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,800,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Gbessay requires a loan in order to buy raw fish for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Gbessay plans to build a house, buy a car and a motor bike and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy raw fish for her business.

loans.name: Fannafa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Fannafa a été créé le 04 janvier 2010.IL est composé de 12 membres qui sont tous issus du même village. 

Madame Agna qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et âgée de 30 ans, elle a en charge 4 enfants dont 3 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité réside dans le commerce des céréales(mil, maïs, arachide)elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne et participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Fannafa community group was formed on 4th January 2010. It has 12 members, all from the same village. Agna, with her arm raised on the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 30 years old and married; she has 4 dependent children, 3 of whom are her own. Her business is the selling of cereal products (millet, corn, peanut), and she has been doing this for several years. 
Her loan will allow her to purchase sufficient stock to meet her customers' demand. Her goal is to increase her savings and to assist with covering the family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Dikore Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIOKORE ENDAM a été créé le 04/01/2010.Il est composé de 22 membres qui sont issus du village environnant.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Salimatou qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée et s'occupe de 06 enfants dont les 04 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité consiste à la vente de légumes(carottes et choux,elle fabrique aussi du savon.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en légumes.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes;accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DIOKORE ENDAM was created on January 4, 2010. It comprises 22 members who are from the same nearby village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Salimatou, who is found at the far right in the photo, is the group's official. She is 45 years old and married, and she takes care of six children. Four of the children are her own.

Her business involves selling vegetables (carrots and cabbage). She also makes soap. She has been active in this kind of work for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on vegetables.

Her goal is to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Drianke Kaffo Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité drianké kaffo a été créé le 04/01/2010.Il est composé de 21 membres qui sont issus des villages environnants.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.
Madame Penda qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupe.

Sa principale activité est le commerce de céréales.Elle achéte du mil qu'elle stocke pour le revendre une fois que les prix seront en hausse.

Elle dispose d'une parfaite expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra  de s'approvisionner en céréales et faire face à la demande.

Son objectif est d'assurer les frais médicaux de ses enfants et leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Drianké Kaffo was created on January 4, 2010. It comprises 21 members who are from nearby villages. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Penda, who is found at the far right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the group's official. 

Her main business involves commerce in grains. She buys millet which she stocks up for resale once prices rise. 

She has excellent experience in this kind of business for having worked at it for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on grains and to cope with the demand.

Her goal is to cover her children's medical costs and their schooling.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Sebastian Ivan

texts.es: Wilson de 49 años  vive en  (paraíso Guayaquil ). El empezo  ese negocio de ser carpintero con su padre siendo oficial ahora el se desempeña en ser maestro de carpintería . también en su tiempo libre cuando el cree necesario es taxista asi teiene dinero adicinal. Con muchas ganas y dedicacio trabaja todos los días. a futuro el desea tener un buen negocio y tener en buena salud a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara herramientas y algunas telas y maquina de coser para ayudarle con herramientas a su esposa en el negocio.
texts.en: Wilson, 49, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  He started the carpentry business with his father who was an officer.  Now he works as a master carpenter.  When he deems it necessary he also works as a taxi driver.  He works every day with much dedication and effort.  In the future he'd like to have a good business and have his family in good health.  He will use the loan to buy tools, as well as some cloths and a sewing machine to help his wife with her business.

loans.use: tools and some cloth and a sewing machine to help with his wife's business

loans.name: Adrian Isidro

texts.es: Adrian de 31 años vive (libertad ecuador) el decidió unirse a este trabajo por la mama y de su esposa- ahora se dedican el y su esposa a la artesanía. Haciendo cadenas, anillos artesanos. Con mucho esfuerzo trabaja todos los días junto a su esposa . a futuro el desea tener una distribuidara de su producto. Con el préstamo comprara (hilos perlas para hacer mas artesanias).
texts.en: Adrian, 31, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  He decided to join this work with his mother and his wife.  Now he and his wife are artisans making artisanal chains and rings.  He works hard every day alongside his wife.  In the future he'd like to have a distributorship for his product.  He will use the loan to buy thread and pearls to make more crafts.

loans.use: to buy pearls and thread.

loans.name: Bokk Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Haby qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de jus de fruit naturel. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 23, 2001. It comprises fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Haby, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 46 years old and a widow with seven children. She also supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in selling natural fruit drinks. She has good experience in this business domain which she has been working at for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further. 

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (heath, food, clothing, etc…) and to increase her saving.

loans.use: to buy goods for making fruit drinks

loans.name: Balante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Banna qui est 2eme à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Mais elle a en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la restauration. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités (riz, huile, et ingrédients pour cuisine)

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 22, 2001. It comprises 12 women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce

Ms. Banna, who is second from the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 55 years old, unmarried, and without children. But she supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in food service. She has good experience in this business domain which she has been working at for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further (rice, oil, and other ingredients for cooking). 

The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc….) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy food provisions for her restaurant

loans.name: Sira Diawara Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité a été créé le 04/01/2010.IL est composé de 23 membres qui sont issus de la meme zone.
Madame Sira qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est responsable du groupement.Elle est âgée de 62 ans et s'occupe de 07 enfants dont 05 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité est l'élevage des moutons.Elle a une bonne expérience de ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis son plus jeune age.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter 03 brebis et de les élever et les revendre une fois qu'ils seront grands.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans la gestion de la maison en participant à la dépense quotidienne,aussi elle compte accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on January 4, 2010. It comprises 23 members from the same area. Ms. Sira, who is found at the far right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the group's official. She is 62 years old and takes care of seven children, of whom five are her own.

Her business involves raising sheep. She has good experience in this kind of business for having worked at it from he earliest age. 

Her loan will enable her to buy 3 young sheep and to raise them for resale once they are big. 

Her goal is to help her husband to manage the house by helping to cover the day-to-day expenses. She also plans on increasing her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise

loans.name: Alexi Noe

texts.es: El joven Alexi tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres, se dedica al cultivo del café quien aprendió el oficio desde que era un niño ya que trabajaba en conjunto con su padre, el inicio a cultivar su propia finca en el cual el trabajo lo realiza a diario. Por otra parte, una de las ventajas de Alexi es que su propiedad se encuentra en una zona muy apta para el cultivo y por lo tanto la producción del Café se da muy bien, por este motivo él se atrevió a solicitar este préstamo ya que necesita comprar abono y chapear la tierra, y así darle un mejor y adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo. Uno de los inconvenientes es la poca mano de obra disponible y el tener que trasladar su producto ya que la cosecha es en temporada de invierno las calles se ponen en mal estado. Su meta es poco a poco ir tecnificando su finca y que esta le genere mayores ganancias. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y piensa invertir muy bien el dinero para luego pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Young Alexi is 25; he is single and lives with his parents. He makes a living growing coffee. He has been learning the craft since he was a boy, working alongside his father. He started to cultivate his own farm, on which he works every day. On the one hand, one of Alexi’s advantages is that his property is located in a very suitable area for growing, and therefore coffee production is coming on well. For this reason, he dares to request this loan, since he needs to buy fertilizer and clear the ground, thus giving him a better and adequate maintenance of the crop. One of the disadvantages is the scarce workforce available, and having to move his product, as harvesting takes place during the winter season and the condition of the roads deteriorates. His goal is to, little by little, make his farm more technical, and this will generate greater profits for him.  It is his first loan cycle with Fama and he plans to invest the money very well so that he will then pay his instalments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of coffee.

loans.name: Jokker Endam De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe tessito a été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Il compte 19 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Ce groupe est caractérisé par un bon climat social. Le nom Bantagnel est emprunté du quartier qui abrite.  Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Binta (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable de groupe.  Elle est âgée de 29 ans, est célibataire et vie avec ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de jus fruit à  base de produits locaux par comme le « bissap, jus de pain de singe, gingembre, de tamarin … » au marché central et dans son quartier. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de trois ans.

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner  en quantité en intrant pour la préparation des différents jus destinés à  la vente.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle compte en partie développer  son commerce, aider ses parents en les appuyant sur la dépense quotidienne et surtout gagner en autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on August 24, 2011 at the inauguration of their <i>banc villageois<i/>. The group comprises 19 members who live in the same district. This group is characterized by a good social atmosphere. The name Bantagnel is borrowed from the district that houses it. The group's main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Binta (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 29 years old and unmarried, and she lives with her parents. She sells fruit juices made from local products, such as <i>bissap<i/> (hibiscus flowers), the juice from 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree), ginger, tamarind…. She makes her sales at the central market and in her district. She enjoys good experience in this business for having worked in it for over three years. 

Her new loan will enable her to stock up more in quantity with the ingredients for making different juices for resale. 

With the profits, she plans in part on developing her business, helping her parents by supporting their day-to-day expenses, and especially achieving financial autonomy.

loans.use: to stock up on ingredients for making different juices for resale

loans.name: Soutoura Kaffo Group

texts.fr:
le groupe SOUTOURA KAFFO a été créé le 31/05/2007. IL est constitué de 14 membres qui sont issus du meme village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité et partageant les mêmes valeurs sociales

Madame Sissakho qui se trouve en position debout sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupement.

Son activité est le commerce de céréales.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercé plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter une quantité suffisante de céréales et de le stocker en vue de les revendre à bon prix.

Son objectif est de continuer à assister son mari en supportant une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la couverture des frais médicaux des enfants.
texts.en:
The group SOUTOURA KAFFO was created on May 31, 2007. It comprises 14 members who are from the same village. They are organized by community and by affinity, and they share the same social values. 

Ms. Sissakho, who is standing in the photo with her left arm raised, is the group's official. 

Her work involves commerce in grains. She has good experience in this kind of business for having working in it for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to buy a sufficient quantity of grains and to store it with the aim of reselling it at a good price. 

Her goal is to continue to help her husband by covering part of the day-to-day expenses and paying for the children's medical costs.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Rangers Group

texts.en: Asanatu is 29 years old. She sells smoked fish and also sews at Takoradi. She lives with her husband, who is a fisherman, and three children. With this loan, Asanatu wants to buy more fish to increase her inventory and sales for a better income. She believes this loan will help her save more money and also expand her business. She is a member of the group called Rangers. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Laabal De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe laabal  été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Ce  groupe est composé de 12 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce. Ces femmes sont très dévouées dans leurs activités.

Madame Ousmane (assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable de groupe, elle est veuve, est âgée de 62 et prend en charge ses six enfants. Elle est très active dans la transformation des produits locaux particulièrement l’arachide, elle est aussi vendeuse de bois de chauffe qu’elle achète dans les villages périphériques de son quartier.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter des graines d’arachide pour la transformation en vue de la vente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge sa famille au niveau sanitaire et alimentation
texts.en:
The group Laabal was created on August 24, 2011 at the inauguration of their <i>banc villageois<i/>. This group comprises 12 members who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. These women are very devoted to their businesses. 

Ms. Ousmane (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is a widow and 62 years old, and she has six children to support. She is very active in processing local products, particularly peanuts. She also sells firewood, which she purchases from the villages surrounding her district. 

With her new loan, she intends to buy some peanuts to process with the aim of selling them. 

The profits from this business will enable her to support her family better with regard to sanitation and food.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to process for resale

loans.name: Djigui Sembe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité djigui sembé a été créé le 31/05/2007.IL est composé de 13 membres qui sont issus du meme village.Elles ont pour activité le petit commerce.
 

Madame Mariama qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupe.Elle est mariée,âgée de 39 ans et mére de 03 enfants,en plus elle a un autre enfant en sa charge.

Elle est propriétaire d'une boutique au niveau du village et exerce cette activité de commerçante depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d'approvisionner sa boutique pour satisfaire sa clientéle qui ne cesse d'augmenter.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne afin d'obtenir un financement plus élevé au prochain cycle.

loans.use: acheter de la marchandise pour sa boutique

loans.name: Tessito De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
