Le groupe tessito a été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Jouissant d’une ambiance parfaite pour un bon travail, ce groupe est composé de 19 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diénabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, est  mariée et  mère de quatre enfants. Elle est vendeuse de tissus au comptant ou par placement à crédit pendant deux mois. Elle est très dynamique et pratique cette activité pendant plus de quatorze mois. Au par avant elle vendait des rafraichissements. 

Son nouveau crédit va lui permettra d’acheter des tissus destinés à la revente.

Les retombées de cette activité lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et alimentaire des membres de la famille.

loans.use: lui permettra d’acheter des tissus destinés à la revente.

loans.name: Bonitas De Treviño Group

texts.es:
Las Bonitas de Treviño son un grupo solidario compuesto por 7 personas de la Colonia Topo Chico en Monterrey. Ellas escogieron este nombre pues dicen ser las mujeres más bonitas de toda la calle Treviño, que es en donde tienen sus juntas semanales.

María del Carmen es una de las integrantes del grupo. Ella tiene 43 años y esta casada. Tiene 2 hijos ya mayores que están actualmente estudiando. Hace poco más de 1 año María del Carmen decidió comenzar a vender ropa. Ella se animo a comprar un catálogo y le empezó ofrecer los productos a sus amigas y familiares, comenzó con poca ropa, pero poco a poco ha ido vendiendo más y más. Ella espera utilizar este crédito para surtir más ropa, ya que ahorita tiene un pedido muy grande el cual espera completar con la ayuda de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Las Bonitas de Treviño are a solidarity group made up of 7 people from the Topo Chico neighborhood in Monterrey.  They chose this name because they say they are the most beautiful women on all of Treviño street, which is where they have their weekly meetings.

María del Carmen is one of the members of the group.  She is 43 years old and married.  She has two adult children who are currently in school.

It has been a little more than a year since María del Carmen decided to start selling clothing.  She was excited to buy a catalog and began offering the products to her friends and family.  She began with a small amount of clothing, but little by little she has been selling more and more.  She hopes to use this loan to stock more clothing, because right now she has a very large order which she hopes to complete with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to stock more clothing

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Caminando Juntos” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de celulares, tornería, confección de ropa, cortinaje, artesanía, venta de leña, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
María presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, en el lugar de en medio, viste con una blusa estampada con colores blancos y negros, además usa una falda larga color negro. Su cabello lo usa corto y es de color castaño oscuro. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un local con venta de abarrotes y demás alimentos (cecinas, pan, bebidas, confites). Trabaja de lunes a domingo de 7ºº de la mañana hasta las 10ºº de la noche, desde hace un año. Comenta que el sector donde vive existen pocos negocios, por lo que no existe competencia. 
Su mercadería la compra preferentemente en supermercados mayoristas y confiterías en el centro de la ciudad.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas son incorporar maquinarias que faciliten su trabajo, como pesa digital, cortadora de cecinas y una congeladora, además de contar con una mayor variedad de productos. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y probablemente le permita generar mayores ingresos. Comenta que disfruta mucho de las reuniones, ya que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y comprometido.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le permiten proyectarse en su negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Caminando Juntos” (Walking Together) and it’s made up of 18 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work among which we have mobile phone sales, lathe shop, clothes making, drape making, crafts, and firewood sales, among others.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

María is communal bank president and appears in the photo seated in the front row in the second spot in the middle and is wearing a black and white printed blouse and a long black skirt.  She wears her hair short and it’s dark brown.

She’s a merchant specifically a grocery and food seller (cecina [cured, dried meat], bread, beverages, and snacks).   She has worked for the last year from Monday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 10 at night.  She comments that in the sector where she lives there are few businesses so there is no competition.  She prefers to buy her merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and sweetshops in the center of the city.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her goal is to incorporate machinery that will ease her work like a digital scale, a meat slicer and a freezer as well as to have a wider variety of products.

María is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is providing her because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business and possibly allow her to generate higher income.  She comments that she enjoys the meetings very much because the communal bank she’s part of is very united and committed.  With respect to the training, it's allowed her to go forward in her business.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  It’s located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  In its surroundings are found lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuche population, indigenous people in our country, live here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has four children. Adjoa is a fishmonger and also sells cooked rice and vegetable stew. She has done this for 15 years. She assists her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food for sale. Adjoa will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom. She buys fresh fish which she smokes and fries for sale. She is married to a farmer and has seven dependents.  Aba has been selling fish for 20 years now. She uses her income to supplement her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Aba will use her loan to buy fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale. She will expand her business with the profit she makes.

loans.use: buy fresh fish to smoke and fry for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa sells shea butter, pomade, and powder. She has done this for 20 years. Hawa lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and her eight dependents at Kwahinkrom, near Elmiina. She uses her income to assist her husband with the general needs of their family. Hawa will use her loan to purchase more shea butter, pomade, and powder to sell. With the new profit she makes, she plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase more shea butter, pomade, and powder to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer and has three children. Efua is a fishmonger and also sells kenkey (traditional Ghanian dish) at Kwahinkrom. Efua uses her income to support her hushand in providing for their family. She will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale, as well as maize to prepare her kenkey. With the new profit, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and maize

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a forty-two-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For ten years he has been distilling alcohol and this has enabled him to provide for his family. His challenge is unpredictable weather which has led to deterioration of yields of his banana plantation. He dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include commercial farming. Pius needs the loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Agripina; continua con la agricultura  en su rama de cereales y todo esto lo seca para venderlo como granos, la socia a mejorado sus ventas y pese a la inclemencia del clima ella pudo rescatar toda su cosecha en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir el dinero para pagar el transporte que lleva sus productos que vende en la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member, Agripina, continues in agriculture in the area of cereals, which she dries to sell as seeds.  She has improved her sales and despite the inclement weather she managed to save her whole crop.

Now she wants to invest in transportation to take her products to the city of Cusco to sell.

loans.use: nvertir el dinero para pagar el transporte que lleva sus productos que vende en la ciudad del Cusco.

loans.name: Waleska Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Waleska de 35 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas, ella vive en su casa con su esposo en San Lorenzo al  sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de elaboración de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, baliadas sus clientes le visitan todas las tardes de lunes a domingo.
Doña Waleska esta solicitando 10,000.00 para compra de Queso, Quesillo, Mantequilla y condimentos, con esta actividad Doña Waleska pretende obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera apoyar a sus hijas que están estudiando.
Doña Waleska su meta es dar apertura a un merendero para atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Waleska sueña con darles una buena educación a sus dos hijas, para que tengan una mejor  calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Mrs. Waleska  is 35 years old, is the mother of two daughters and she lives in her home with her husband in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. For three years she has dedicated herself to her business creating meals like tacos, enchiladas and baliadas (refried beans and cheese in a taco shell). Her customers visit her every afternoon from Monday to Sunday. Mrs. Waleska is requesting $525 to buy cheese, soft cheese, butter and condiments. Through this activity, Mrs. Waleska intends to obtain larger earnings and she will support her daughters that are studying this way. 

Mrs. Waleska's goal is also to open a patio to better serve her customers.

Mrs. Waleska dreams of giving her two daughters a good education so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, butter, soft cheese and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Bertha Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta de 44 años de edad, es casada, vive con una de sus dos hijas en su casa en Valle al sur de Honduras, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y le apoya económicamente.
Doña Berta desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la confección de prendas para damas como trajes, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc., con esta actividad a podido sacar delante a su  familia, esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para confeccionar los trajes, 
Doña Berta pretende que con las utilidades de este préstamo invertido en su negocio mejorara sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, Ella desea que su negocio crezca y que su familia prospere. 
El sueño de Doña Berta es tener su casa con piso de cerámica. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Bertha is 44 years old, is married and lives with one of her two daughters in her house in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Her husband is a mason and he supports her economically.

For twenty years, Bertha has dedicated herself to the creation of clothing for women like suits, dresses, skirts, pants, etc. Through this activity she has been able to get ahead with her family. She is requesting $525 to buy fabrics, buttons, threads and other accessories to create the suits.
Bertha intends to use the proceeds of this loan, invested in her business, to better the condition of her life and the life of her family. She desires for her business to grow and for her family to prosper.

Bertha's dream is to have a house with a ceramic floor.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, threads and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Libertad 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña   María  es  una   persona  muy  emprendedora,  dedicada  a su  negocio actualmente  tiene  su  vivienda  cerca   con  su madre  y tres hijas. Ella vive en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña María es panadera elabora y vende de pan. Ella necesita el préstamo para la compra harina, huevos, azúcar, leña y manteca. Doña María espera que con este préstamo tener más pan en variedad con esto aumentar sus ventas.   Doña María Sueña con educar a sus hijas y poner una panadería grande y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes para que sus panes se vendan en mas lugares. 
La joven Lesly se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una empresa, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace más de 5 años y vive con sus padres.
La Señora Deysi se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su caserío. Desde  hace mas de 10 años, ella madre de 2 hijos los que tiene de corta edad cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y actualmente vive con ellos.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Maria is a very entrepreneurial person and dedicates herself to her current business that she has near her home with her mother and three daughters. She lives in the south of Honduras. Maria is a baker and she produces and sells bread. She needs the loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard. Maria hopes that with this loan she will have a larger variety of bread and that this will increase her sales. Maria dreams of educating her daughters, of running a larger bakery and of satisfying the needs of her clients so that she can sell her bread in more places. 

The youngster Lesly dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics as a business. She has dedicated herself to this task for more than 5 years and she lives with her parents.

Deysi dedicates herself to the sale of consigned clothing in her hamlet and has done so for more than 10 years. She is the mother of two sons that she had when she was very young and she counts on the support of her parents with whom she lives with today.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard for their business.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a 30-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Suhad is looking to improve her family's living conditions by requesting a loan of 800 JD for doing maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and runs a green grocery stall which has been operating for the last twenty-three years. Besides this, Martha is a farmer and also sells clothes. 

Martha sold some of her farm produce to obtain capital for the current business. She joined Milango to access credit for further business expansion and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional clothes to sell. 

Her future ambition is to own a parcel of land and construct a house. The challenges she needs to overcome are the high cost of transportation and the related fees she pays the government while operating the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in the coastal town of Changamwe. She is a married mother of three children and runs a food stall marketing meat directly from the slaughter houses. She started the business from an $18 capital.

Tina faces the challenge of lack of proper storage methods and would like to have storage facilities and proper display. The others are fragile business climate and some clients not paying on time. She also looks forward to owning a soft drinks depot. Tina is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency. This will help increase her income/earnings for the developments she aspires to make.
Her customers have continued to grow and her ambition is to build a permanent stall.

loans.use: To purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is from the Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is sixty-five years old. Lydia is married and has three children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man.  He has 4 children and 3 are enrolled in school. Said operates a coconut selling business and sells his goods wholesale. He has worked in this business for 4 years and was previously employed as a seller of fried fish. His primary customers are coconut firms. Said's other source of income includes a motorcycle repairs business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation.  His highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Said will use the Kes 25000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. Said aspires to increase his number of coconuts to supply more in the future.  He joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: buy coconuts

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors (in the photo) is 41years old and her husband; Sot is 48 years old, live in in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married 1987 and have three sons-one is a teacher, another one is in pedagogy and another one attends primary school. 

Samphors sells grocery items and sugarcane juice at her home, while her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son who is in pedagogy to drive to school. He will become to teacher.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna (in the photo) is 41years old and her husband, Thol is 47 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married 1987 and have three sons and two daughters. All of their children are garments workers.  

Vanna is a garment worker, while her husband is a rice farmer and raises cow at home. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for children to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda (in the photo), age 37, sells food and Chines noodle and coffee. Her husband, Bunthon, age 35, is assisting his wife in the business. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they just have two children-one son who is still young and one daughter who is in school. 

Lyda is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a cow to raise. She will get extra income from selling cow for beef or sale for calf when the cow gives a baby.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon (in the photo), age 49, is a weaver and does farming when farming season come. Her husband, Sotheavy, age 46, is a house constructor. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have six children-two sons and four daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a garment worker and another one is a hairdresser.  

Sinuon is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (in the photo), age 31, is a house constructor. His wife, Rina, age 27, is a weaver. They have been married since 2005 and just have one young daughter. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Chan is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more construction materials for his house construction business. He will also use a part of the loan to repair the house where he lives because his house breaks in some part.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials and repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak (in the photo), age 32, is a construction worker. His wife stays at home. She wants to launch business-selling food and coffee and build shelter to shade. Hence, Vannak decides to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to help capital his wife. 
 

Vannak and his wife have been married since 2005 and they have two young daughters. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To help capital his wife to launch business-selling food and coffee and build shelter to shade.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (pictured here) and her husband, Sam on, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and they have seven children-five sons and two daughters. One is married and lives separately, one is a driver, one is a garment worker, another one workers for a bakery and two attend school and another one is still young. 

Ny sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman and a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi driver to remoque driver, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence Ny decides to ask for a loan of $400 to buy a trailer for her husband. 

A remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara (in the photo) now sells meat balls and boiled duck eggs at home and she sells fish that her husband catches in her local market. Her husband is a fisherman. In the past, Nara used to be a garment worker. The couple has been married since 1993 and they have two children
who are in school. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The walls of Nara’s are old and break, she wants to make the repairs. Hence, Nara is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old and her husband; Panha is 31 years old, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet.

Sophea is a silk weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get work. She will also use a part of the loan to buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is an ambitious 23-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been operating a retail shop. He opened his shop after he saved enough income from his brick-laying activities. His challenges include price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He has dreams of educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Patrick needs the loan to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a 35-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has owned a liquor store for ten years now. The main challenge he faces is the common bacteria that causes bananas to wilt. Bananas are his raw materials, and, in addition to crop diseases caused by bacteria, the changing seasons make it difficult to sustainably produce liquor.

In a bid to diversify his business and create more sources of income, Bosco intends to buy a motorcycle for transportation. He also dreams of educating his children.B osco needs this loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Kyakahirwa Kayemba Association Group

texts.en: Herbert is a30-year-old hardworking man and a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing the loan. For a year, he has been growing maize and his previous harvest was very fruitful. His challenge is unpredictable seasonal weather and his dream is to buy land to grow more crops. Herbert needs the loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to  buy maize to plant

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, ella es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Hace algunos años comenzó vendiendo golosinas pero hace tres años inicio el negocio de la pulpería vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. 
Inicio a trabajar por cuenta propia y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio, su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 5:30 a.m y culmina a las 9:00 p.m. Sonia solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, sal, frijoles, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para poder apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es poner una bodega en la Ciudad de Juticalpa. Doña Sonia tiene 5 ciclos de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sonia is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband makes a living in livestock farming. She is a kind, helpful, and cheerful person. She has a small grocery store in her home. Several years ago, she began selling candy but three years ago she started the grocery store business, selling products such as sugar, rice, lard, beans and other domestic use products. Then she began stocking her business with other products that her customers recommended she sell.

She began working a self-employed businesswoman and in time she learned to manage her business, with her working hours from 5:30am to 9:00pm. Sonia is requesting this loan in order to invest in buying products such as rice, sugar, lard, salt, and beans among others. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and continue to have a source of income to help her husband with family expenses.Her goal is to have a small grocery store in the city of Juticalpa. Sonia is in her fifth loan cycle of receiving support from FAMA through the loans she has obtained. She has maintained a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, soap and other items

loans.name: Gloria Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella vive con su familia en una Aldea, sus hijos le acompañan en su negocio y su casa y su esposo se dedica a su taller de Carpintería en el departamento de Francisco Morazán.
El negocio de Doña Gloria  es la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, catrachas, pollo frito, carne asada, pescado frito, refrescos, jugos, agua, entre otros productos.
Doña Gloria esta solicitando la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de productos para elaborar golosinas y comida como Carnes, Pescado, Harina, Manteca, Verduras y condimentos.
Con el apoyo de este tipo de créditos comprara productos para abastecer su negocio y lograr incrementar el nivel de sus ingresos y aumentar sus clientes.
Entre los planes de Doña Gloria esta expandir su negocio, ya que le gustaría acondicionar más su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a village.  Her children accompany her at work and at home and her husband works in his carpentry shop in Francisco Morazán Department.

Gloria’s business is selling snacks like tacos, enchiladas, meat pies, “catrachas” {fried corn tortilla with beans, “chismol” [chopped tomatoes, onion and cilantro with lemon and spices] sauce, cilantro marinated tomatoes, red onion and grated dry cheese}, fried chicken, grilled meat, fried fish, soft-drinks, juice and water, among other products.

Gloria is asking for the amount of 8000 lempiras to buy ingredients to make snacks and food like meats, fish, flour, lard, vegetables and condiments.  With support from this type of loan she will buy products to stock her business and increase her income level and number of customers.   Among Gloria’s plans is to expand the business since she’d like to better equip it.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2912

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, flour, lard, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Kleber Alberto

texts.es: Kleber de 37 años vivve ( Quevedo ecuador ) el decidió ponerse el negocio de restaurant por que le da mayor rentabilidad y no le gusta ser empleado.  El trabaja todos los días solo de 7:00 a 2pm con mucho esfuerzo. A futuro el desea mejorar su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su hijo . con el préstamo comprara ( viveres ) carnes, arroz, aceite.
texts.en: Kleber, 37, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He decided to start up a restaurant business because it is profitable, and he did not like being an employee.  He works on his own every day from 7am until 2pm with a lot of effort.  In the future, he wants to make some improvements to his house and provide the best for his child.  With this loan, he will buy food supplies including meat, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn and her husband, Hieng, live in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have seven children-three sons and four daughters. Three are married and live separately, two are garment workers and other are in school.  

Soeurn and her husband rice farmers. In addition, Soeurn’s husband also purchases, raising, and selling cows. He wants to expand his business by buying additional cows to raise. Hence, Soeurn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her husband’s capital. 

Photo: Soeurn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha (pictured here) is 46 years old and her husband; Koemthong is 45 years old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have four children-two sons and two daughters. Two are married and live separately and other two are in school. 

Chantha stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He operates battery charging business and he is a tractor repairman. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 materials for her husband’s tractor repairing business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos (in the photo with her daughter) and her husband, Kheng are fishermen. In addition, they also grow rice when rice farming season come. The couple has been married since 2002 and they have three children-two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and another one is still young. 

Ruos is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional fishing materials and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin (pictured here) is a construction worker and his wife, Yet is a rice farmer. And he also assists his wife in rice farming when he is free. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have seven children-one son and six daughters. Five are married and live separately and others are garment workers. 

Yin is asking for a loan of $700 to buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai (pictured here), age 65, is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a construction worker and another one has full-time employment. She lives on an island on Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai stays at home. The main source of income is from her son who is a construction worker and her daughter who has full-time employment. She is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran (pictured here), age 28, is a taxi driver. His wife, Srei Lors, age 24, is a hairdresser. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have one young daughter.  

Ran is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to repair his taxi. Because his taxi’s spare part breaks, this upset his business.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 24-year-old woman. She has a one-year-old son. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined woman. 

Stella does dairy farming and sells milk in an area conducive to the general public. She has been in this business for one year. In addition, Stella  also provides rental housing services to increase her income. She works hard to support her family. 

Stella is facing a challenge of inadequate funds to expand her business. She plans to and will use the loan of KES 20,000 to pay for the renovation of her rental houses.  Stella's dream and hope is to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Sokmaly

texts.en:
Sokmaly (pictured here), age 54, is a weaver. Her husband, Phy, age 56, is a house constructor. In addition, the couple also grows rice when rice farming season come. They live in a village along Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. And they have twelve children-six are married and live separately, two have full-time employment, one is a garment work and two are monks and another one attends school. 

Sokmaly is asking for a loan of $300 to put additional of her house.

loans.use: To put additional of her house.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Ms. Marilou is 54 years old and lives in Brgy. 2, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Ms. Marilou has a  business of grocery store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amount of 10,000 for additional business capital. Ms. Marilou joined PMPC just this year.
 In the future, Ms. Marilou hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries goods for the grocery store

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. she is the mother of seven children.
Khadra hs a home based project she sells cosmotics, now she is planning to purchase a fridgerator so that she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to improve her family life's conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new fridgerator for her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 53   años, está casada y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su finca, la cual cuenta con una parte de café y la otra de pasto en la que tiene unas vacas. Ella  pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha del café y sembrar una mejor calidad de pasto para sus vacas. Ella quiere obtener una buena producción del café y con mejores pastos poder obtener mejores resultados con el ganado y poder mantener mas vacas. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 53, is married and lives with his wife and 2 children. He plans to use the loan to help his farm, part of which grows coffee and the other part is pasture where he has some cows. He will invest in inputs like compost, labor and fungicides so that he can get a better coffee harvest and plant better-quality grass for his cows. He wants to get a good coffee production and use better grass so that he can get better results from his cattle and maintain more cows. He wants to generate more income for the well-being of his family and himself, and to have greater financial stability. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y trato jovial. Está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 26 años y Neri de 19 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, hijos mas sus 2 nietos, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Elena  es la venta de abarrotes en general y yucas, para eso abrió una bodega en su propia casa atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes. 
Empezó con un apoyo financiero de MFP, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, logrando crecer a base de esfuerzo, realizándola ella sola. Iniciándose hace más de 6 meses contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención al público consumidor.
Considera su negocio rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues cuenta con una regular clientela.
Su negocio le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, al contrario no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan. Por tanto tiene deseos de  crecer y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un bazar donde pueda vender toda clase de productos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría, aun existe el ingreso de algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros. También de yucas ya que los precios de éste producto están al alza, dejándole mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena, age 56, is a cheerful and hard-working woman, and she also has a very kind and jovial manner.  She is married to Roberto, a craftsman and father of their two children.  Wilson is 26 years old, and Neri is 19 years old.  She lives with her husband, her children, and two grandchildren in her own house.

Elena’s business is selling general groceries.  She opened a grocery store in her house in order to do this.  She also sells yuccas, and she kindly tends to her customers.  She started with financial support from MFP.  She purchased in small quantities, and she managed to grow from the foundation of hard work.  Over the time that she had her business she worked alone.  However, starting over six month ago she counts on her son’s help in waiting on the public.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the income it gives her, and because she has a regular clientele.  Her business allows her to be at home in order to be able to tend to her young child.  The financial income serves her to buy what she needs for her household.  On the other hand, she does not like that some of her customers ask for credit.  When it comes time to pay they put it off.  Even so, she sees that her business is well-received.  Therefore, she wishes to grow and expand her grocery store until she can convert it into a bazaar where she will be able to sell all types of products.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration so that she will be able to firm up her plans.  Also, she feels good with her communal bank.  She knows most of them, and new members are joining.  She hopes they will be as responsible as the rest of the group.  She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy wholesale groceries like sugar, rice, oil, and others for her grocery store.  She will also buy yuccas because the prices for this product are rising, which leaves her with greater income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and yucca.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Intibucá, La Esperanza.
Pedro y su esposa se ayudan mutuamente y tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente la siembra del cultivo de papa. EL vende la papa en producto fresco en el mercado local. Siendo muy  pequeño aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que esa ha sido la tradición familiar.  Siembra 2 tareas de papa 3 ciclos por año. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias por el cual esta muy contento y por eso dedica 9 horas diarias trabajando en sus cultivos.
El préstamo que ha solicitado de 10,000 lempiras considera que es una oportunidad para mejorar su producción dándole el mantenimiento requerido por lo tanto la inversión que hará es comprar fertilizante y pesticida para el control de plaga para su cultivo. Mejorando obtener una mejor cosecha y seguir vendiendo.
Su intención es seguirle dando el mantenimiento necesario para seguir generando el capital que le ayude a sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 30 years old, married, and has a two-year-old son.  He lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Intibucá, La Esperanza.

Nelson and his wife help one another.  They have 10 years of experience in the agriculture business and specialize in the cultivation of potatoes.  He sells fresh potatoes at the local market.  At a young age, Pedro learned to work the land and has continued the family tradition.  He plants two crops of potatoes within a three-cycle period each year.  This business has generated a good income, so he is very pleased.  Pedro works nine hours each day tending to his crops.

The loan he is requesting in the amount of 10,000 HNL represents an opportunity to improve his production.  Maintaining his crops requires an investment in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides to control diseases to his crop.  These improvements will result in a better harvest and enable him to continue selling.  His intention is to provide the maintenance required to generate capital to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible housewife who aims to improve her status of living and to give her children a better life. She is now 56 years of age and has three grown-up children. Due to financial burden, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They planned to expand their corn plantation to increase their yield and income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies.   Despite the hardships they encountered in farming, they have the determination to work out their plan. 

Virginia is asking for an additional capital of PHP 46,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn. She believes that the loan will help them to work out their plan and hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a responsible mother who helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high yield. She is now 40 years old and has five school-age children. Joy and her husband aim to improve their source of living to satisfy their family's needs and continue sending their children to school. They have been operating their business for almost 20 years, earning a profit of PHP 26,000 every harvest season. They utilize their income for their food, clothing and allowances for their children. 

Due to financial constraints, Joy is asking for an additional capital of PHP 49,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in transplanting rice. They believe that their patience and hard work will bear a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay labor cost

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Paul Muchira

texts.en: Paul is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use this loan to buy timber and paint for his furniture making business.  With the anticipated profit from the loan, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting timber.

loans.use: buy timber and paint

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the village of Villa Concepcion. He is married and has two children. Ronaldo is engaged in his sari-sari store for five years. This is the only source of income for his family. That is why he works hard to uplift his family from poor living. 

Ronaldo wants to buy additional stocks of items to sell, but he lacks the necessary capital.  In this  regard, Ronaldo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, sugar, vinegar, salt, bread, and daily use products to sell. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells clothes, and has been in business for 5 years. She is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school.

Eveline heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Furimuna

texts.en:
Furimuna lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 3 years. She is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school.

Furimuna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Duo Luchadoras De Montufar Group

texts.es:
DUO LUCHADORAS DE MONTUFAR
Es integrada por la señoras: Margarita de 46 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad uno de ellos curso el nivel primario, y una pequeñita de 3años de edad, doña Margarita hace 18 años inicio su pequeño negocio con la venta de frijol, y maíz en el mercado de la localidad Pero luego de fallecer su suegra ella  continua en atender la venta de consumo diario que  su suegra atendía, desde entonces ha luchado y ha visto los frutos de su negocio, además de esto ella se dedica a la crianza de animales a lo cual también le saca un buen provecho y beneficio a sus ingresos,esta solicitandop este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario. Por otra parte doña Priscilia de 41 años de edad, casada y madre de 7 hijos se dedica a la venta de tomate y carnes.
texts.en:
Dúo Luchadoras de Montufar is made up of two women.

Margarita, 46, is married and has two minor children.  One of them is in elementary school and the other little one is three years old.  Eighteen years ago Margarita started her little business selling beans and corn in the town market, but after her mother-in-law died she continued the grocery store that her mother-in-law ran.  Since then she has struggled and she has seen the benefits of her business.  In addition to this, she works raising animals, which also gives her good benefits and profits.

She is requesting this loan to buy food products of daily consumption.

On the other hand, Priscila Cuá Canel, 41, is married and the mother of seven children.  She works selling tomatoes and meat.

loans.use: to buy daily convenience products.

loans.name: Duo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es: Duo Peña de Oro, Vivian Isabel de 31 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos,se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años ella nos cuenta que a luchado por sus hijos ya que el mas grande sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas ya que nececita mas capital y asi seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
This is the "Duo Peña de Oro" group. Vivian Isabel is 31, married, and has two children.  She has been selling tortillas for five years. She tells us that she has struggled for her children's sake, as her greatest dream is for her children to have a better future.  

She is applying for this loan in order to buy corn for making tortillas, as she needs more working capital. This way she will keep her business growing.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Raised in Hawaii, Veronica, 41, wanted to bring the relaxed feel of the island to her hometown of San Antonio by opening the hair salon, Hair in Paradise. "I don’t like the everyday-type salons,” Veronica said. What sets her salon apart, she said, is her hospitality.

By the age of 17, Veronica decided to get into the cosmetology industry. Shortly afterwards, she studied cosmetology in Hawaii. She studied cosmetology again when she returned to San Antonio in 2002. She has 23 years of hair styling experience and opened her business in 2005.

“Becoming an entrepreneur is something that I always wanted to do,” she said. “I worked in places where it’s been a lot of chaos. When you get women together, you get a lot of opinions. I wanted to have my own place to give customer service my way. I listen to the customers and give them what they ask for.”

This initiated Veronica’s new loan with ACCION Texas Inc. She plans to use it to purchase items from Hawaii to resell within the shop, as requested by her clientele, and to improve its Hawaiian paradise feel. Veronica also plans to update her shop with new paint and repair minor problems.

Continuing about her love for the industry, Veronica said, “I like working with hair and am comfortable with making people feel good about themselves.” She said,  “If your hair looks good, you feel good. It’s gratifying to me to know I can do that.”

At Hair in Paradise, Veronica employs two other people: one receptionist and one stylist. As her business grows, Veronica plans to hire more employees. 

Veronica said the loan will help her business grow and allow her salon “to be more inviting to my customers and make them feel more relaxed.”

A returning ACCION client, Veronica said previous loans affected her business positively. “ACCION is a good company,” she said. “The loan officers I worked with seemed interested in what I wanted to do. I felt comfortable with them.” 

Those previous loans allowed her to make her salon more comfortable, have the necessities needed to build the shop and make it stronger. 

Find Veronica on Facebook at www.facebook.com/hairinparadise/140584502644859 or at her website, www.hairinparadise.com.

loans.use: to purchase gift items to sell in her salon

loans.name: 04.07.10 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hưng is applying for a loan to purchase coal to make processed coal for resale. She has a manufacturing business making coal.

Hưng is 53-years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

Hưng is the group leader of the 04.07.10 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2011, Hưng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hưng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hưng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Hưng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase coal to make processed coal for resale.

loans.name: 03-8-87-Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Hướng works in agricultural farming raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future. Hướng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hướng is 44-years-old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

Hướng is the group leader of the 03-8-87-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. This is Hướng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

The main harship that Hướng faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hướng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Nansalmaa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and the children are school students. 

She started her meat retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 

She travels through rural areas to collect her supply, and transport is her biggest expense. Therefore, she is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy a car to save her expense. A quick calculation shows that it will save her 40% and it would help her to explore additional suppliers.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan lives in Kator. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 36 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Juan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nalweyo Scc Group

texts.en: Scovia is 43 years old and a married mother of 7 children.She opened a restaurant business which she has been running for 10 months and she has high hopes that the business will grow.She is a group member of Nalweyo SCC group and she faces a challenge of price fluctuation and high transport costs,her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets.Scovia needs the loan to buy tables and food for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and food for her restuarant.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a petty trader at Mpohr, near Takoradi. She has done this for 1 year now. The items she sells are milk, milo, sugar, soups, tin tomatoes, tin fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, etc.. She is married and has 5 children. She uses her income to support the husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy sells bags of rice and operates a grocery shop at Mpohr near Takoradi. She has been operating this grocery shop for 5 years now. Some of the items in her grocery shop are milk, milo, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tin tomatoes, tin fish, etc.. Nancy is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security officer. She uses her income to support the husband to pay the utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Nancy  plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a 26-year-old woman. She is single with two children, and she has a boutique business in Kimana. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase new clothes for sale. In the future, she wants to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 40 años, está casada con Guzmán, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años. A los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Yaroca, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Aurelia dice que le agrada esta actividad por su libertad y autonomía. En todo este tiempo aprendió a producir arvejas, papas, gladiolos y maíz. Pero afirma que los productos que más satisfacción le generan son las flores de gladiolos y arvejas. “Cada temporada siembra 3 bolsas de gladiolos”, dice. Por otro lado, su esposo, cuenta con 2 carros de su propiedad, con los que trabaja brindando servicios de transporte. Con ambas actividades pueden solventar sus gastos básicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Les va muy bien.
Es por eso que para más adelante Aurelia, desea comprar más autos y de esa manera abarcar más poblados lejanos. Para entonces sus hijos ya tendrán la edad suficiente para hacerse cargo de esas labores. Este sería su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroca”, por la solidaridad entre las socias.
De recibir el dinero podrá comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1800 soles. Lo restante será para comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fortalecer la siembra de arvejas.
texts.en: Aurelia is 40 years old, she is married to Guzmán, with whom she has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 12. They raise and educate them in the home they own in the village of Yaroca, in the Palca district of the Tarma region in Peru. She has worked in agriculture for over 20 years. Aurelia says she enjoys this activity because of the freedom and independence it affords her. In all those years, she learned how to grow peas, potatoes, gladioli and corn, but she says that the ones she enjoys most are the flowers and the peas. "Every season, I plant 3 sacks of gladiolus seeds", she says. As for her husband, he owns two cars with which he works offering transport services in both directions between Tarma and Palca. Thanks to these two activities, they are able to cover basic expenses and better their quality of life. That is why in the future Aurelia hopes to buy more cars and thus offer transport to more towns that are far away. At that point in time her sons would be old enough to take up that activity. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, thus she gives her word that she will pay her monthly installments on time. She likes working with her village bank "Las Truchitas de Yaroca" because  of the solidarity between the members. With this loan, she will be able to buy 3 sacks of pea seeds with 1800 soles. The rest she will use to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres La Giralda Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres la Giralda. Dolores.tiene 59 años de edad es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos a mano y a la crianza de animales desde hace varios años,ya que ella es una persona que vive sola y ella dia a dia se dedica a su actividad economica ya que su esposo a fallecido y ella a salido adelante por si sola, tambien se dedica a la venta de chuchitos tamales y chiles rellenos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos y para la compra de insumos para elavorar tamales.
texts.en: Dolores is a 59 year-old hardworking woman and a member of Duo Mujeres de la Giralda Communal Bank. She has been producing hand-made traditional woven goods for several years, as well as raising animals, since she is a person who lives alone. Day after day, she works hard since her husband has passed away and she has to get ahead on her own. She also sells small Guatemalan tamales and chiles rellenos. She is applying for a loan to buy the basic materials to make her woven goods and the supplies to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to make woven goods and the ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 55 years old and married to Benjamin. She operates a rental houses business and has been in the business for the past five years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and plans to use this loan amount to buy building materials to complete the construction of the rental houses. 

In the future, Loise hopes to buy a plot and build more rental houses and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transport, where he has worked for over four years. He acquired capital through savings got from casual laborers. He faces problems of price fluctuation and high fuel and transport costs. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying land to grow crops. John needs this loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 38-year-old married lady with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. She has been a dealer in clothing for eight years now, after starting with capital given to her from her husband. The capital was 300,000 and has grown to 2.5 million. The major hardships are high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Enid needs a loan to buy new textiles for resale.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a twenty-five-year-old woman, who is single with two children. She runs a cafeteria business in Loitoktok. She has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of five thousand six hundred shillings.

 
This will be Sophia’s first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more tables and chairs, and with the profit that she will get, she wants to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy assets like tables and chairs

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jalia has been working hard to manage her small business which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Jalia to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Jalia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jalia's future prospects by helping her to .

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick has been in farming for  six years and produces mainly milk which he sells to the local market. He runs a tea retail business as well to supplement his farming income with some of the tea being sourced from his farm and some from other farmers. He is aged 28 and married with two children aged seven and three years.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to to help him construct a bigger and  better dairy unit for his growing number of dairy cows. He is confident his milk output will double  in the near future and he will be in a better position to meet family needs.

He laments of poor weather conditions but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan terms, especially the grace period provided for loan repayment.

loans.use: To construct a bigger dairy unit in his farm

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is aged 33 and has been farming in her rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya for 5 years. Her farm produce of tea and milk are sold within the local market.

Evaline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. She says this will improve her animal feeding and double the milk output. She plans to venture into the transport business by buying a motorcycle .

Evaline laments costly finances and rampant drought.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Sauya's Group

texts.en:
Sauya's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Sauya is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi, in the Kampala region in eastern Uganda. For the past two years, Sauya has been working hard to manage her small market, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sauya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Sauya to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Sauya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Sauya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Sauya's future prospects by helping her to .

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Mariam is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in Kampala, a region in the eastern part of Uganda. For the past year, Mariam has been working hard to manage her mobile business, through which she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase the capital in her business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mariam's future prospects by helping her to .

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Maria es miembro del grupo, y cuenta con una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos y personas de barrios aledaños. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio que le puso al negocio, ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo de a poco.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, hortalizas, bebidas, panes, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group San Ramon was born through the management and support of another group in the same town. The group is in the city of San Lorenzo and the main objective of the members is growth - both personal and financial. 

Maria is a member of the group and she has a well-stocked store where her neighbors and people from nearby neighborhoods get their supplies. She tells us that she started with a small business, but thanks to her hard work and sacrifice she was able to get ahead and to grow her business little by little.

She asks for a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, drinks, bread, dairy products and other things she needs to stock her business and keep growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, bread, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Hellen is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and pay for her own house rent. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hellen's future prospects by helping her to

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Carol's Group

texts.en:
Carol's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Carol is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Carol has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Carol has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Carol to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Carol hopes that in the future she will be able to own a designing shop. 

Carol is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Carol's future prospects by helping her to .

loans.use: buy sugar and soap

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Falilatu.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 4 yrs. She has 2 additional dependents.  

In 2010, Falilatu established her medical services business. She began her business because she was trained as a nurse and decided to start her own business in medicine. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Falilatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.   She requires a loan in order to buy more medicine in a large quantity. In the future, Falilatu plans to build her own hospital that will be managed by herself.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Musa.  He is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 16 yrs.  In 2005, Musa established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because he did not go to school and needed to be self-employed. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

Musa would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,500,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid his second loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more drinks.  In the future, Musa plans to build his own house to live in with his family.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy drinks

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 30, 26 and 20. 

In 2002, Kadiatu established her motor vehivcle spare parts business. She began her business because there was no one to take care of her schooling. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 980,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to  buy more spare parts like oil filter,clutch plate,engine oil in a very large quantity.  In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a bigger outlet to be managed by her husband.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Righteous Group

texts.en:
Haja sells market food: pepper, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. She has been a businesswoman for six years now. Haja was born in Makeni city, about 25 years ago. She is married to a student and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. 

Haja is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. With the help of this loan, Haja and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Haja will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 leones) to buy pepper, salt, Maggi, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy pepper, salt, Maggi, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa cooks banku and she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Dompoase near Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has six dependants. Adjoa has been in this business for 10 years now. Adjoa is a single parent. As a single parent, she uses her income for the general up keep of her children. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku to sell. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo tiene el nombre de “La Carrera”, ellos pertenecen a la comunidad de Dotegiare ubicada en el municipio de San Felipe del Progreso, las integrantes de este grupo decidieron aponerle este nombre ya que para ellas representa una carrera con la vida, ellas creen que la vida es como una carrera que siempre hay que ganar y es la base de su esfuerzo constante, ésta se caracteriza por ser  una comunidad mazahua con personas muy trabajadoras y de conocimientos de artesanías mazahuas,  orgullosos de sus raíces, aunque es una comunidad pequeña las  personas son muy unidas, es una comunidad pequeña y prácticamente todos los habitantes se conocen unos a otros, lo conforman 12 mujeres muy humildes y trabajadoras, las cuales decidieron unirse a este grupo para poder emprender una actividad productiva.
Los nombres de las integrantes y sus respectivas actividades son las siguientes:
1.- María Ángela B. (compra de refrescos y dulces para vender)
2.- María Bonifacia G. (compra de servilletas, manteles, hilos, para costura y venta)
3.- Victoria S. (compra de frutas y verduras para vender)
4.- Alejandra M. (compra de 5 borregos para vender)
5.- María S. (compra de 2 borregos para vender)
6.- María del Carmen S. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
7.- Ma. Elena T. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
8.- Virginia M. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
9.- Catalina R. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
10.- Rosaura L. (compra de 4 borregos para cría y venta)
11.- Celia C. (compra de abarrotes para vender)
12.- Juana M. (compra de dulces para vender)
Doña Victoria es una mujer de 39 años de edad que estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, la cual se dedica al trabajo en el hogar, ella es la representante de este grupo y está casada desde hace 15 años con el señor Doroteo, juntos tuvieron a 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años, los cuales actualmente estudian. La señora Victoria es clienta de FRAC y es muy responsable y optimista, ella solicita este crédito porque se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, en esta ocasión ella comprará: jitomate, tomate, chiles, cebollas, papas, nopales, plátanos y mangos.  Ella compra su fruta cada 8 días en un municipio llamado Atlacomulco, y se la lleva a su casa donde la vende, o sale a ofrecerla casa por casa, a ella se le ocurrió emprender este negocio para apoyarse en los gastos de la escuela y sustento de sus hijos, ya que por ahora no se encuentra con ella su esposo, en este negocio lleva ya 2 años de experiencia, en los que comenta le ha ido muy bien y el único problema que ha tenido para desarrollar su actividad es una enfermedad que le dio en sus pies y hace que se canse mucho cuando va caminando para ofrecer sus frutas y verduras, dice que el préstamo si le ayuda mucho ya que invierte y saca una ganancia que le ayuda bastante con sus gastos, a la señora Victoria le gustaría en un futuro comprarse un medio de transporte que le facilite el transporte de sus productos y no le cause molestias en sus pies.
texts.en:
The following group is called "La Carrera." The members belong to the community of Dotegiare, which is located in the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso. The members of this group decided to give their group this name since to them it represents a race with life. They believe that life is like a race which always has to be won, and this is the base of their constant effort.
